meanings.sent1: The tricky riddle can befuddle even the smartest person.
meanings.sent2: The complex instructions may befuddle some students.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solve the puzzle only served to befuddle him further.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected question seemed to befuddle his logical reasoning.
meanings.sent5: The maze of mirrors in the funhouse was designed to befuddle visitors.

meanings.definition: To make someone unable to think clearly
meanings.sent1: The loud noise seemed to befuddle his concentration during the test.
meanings.sent2: The strong medication can befuddle the patient's mind temporarily.
meanings.sent3: The lack of sleep can befuddle your ability to make decisions.
meanings.sent4: The conflicting information may befuddle even the most focused individual.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in plans can befuddle even the most organized person.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become disoriented or bewildered
meanings.sent1: The unexpected turn of events can befuddle anyone.
meanings.sent2: The dense fog can befuddle a person's sense of direction.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks never fail to befuddle the audience.
meanings.sent4: The intricate plot of the movie may befuddle some viewers.
meanings.sent5: The rapid changes in weather can befuddle even experienced hikers.
